info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 20 at 3:28PM EDT until May 20 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN BERKS...SOUTHEASTERN LEHIGH...NORTHWESTERN MONTGOMERY...WEST CENTRAL BUCKS AND NORTHEASTERN CHESTER COUNTIES... At 328 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Zionsville to Pottstown to Glenmoore, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Pottstown, Phoenixville, Downingtown, Birdsboro, Collegeville, Royersford, Trappe, East Greenville, Schwenksville, Elverson, Bally, Bechtelsville, Green Lane, New Morgan, Zionsville, Pughtown, Spring Mount, Lionville-Marchwood, Glenmoore and Chester Springs. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 299 and 321. Northeast Extension between mile markers 35 and 50. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Pennsylvania. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
